TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SwitchAttribute extends System.Attribute
Public NotInheritable Class SwitchAttribute Inherits Attribute
public ref class SwitchAttribute sealed : Attribute

Docs.summary: Identifies a switch used in an assembly, class, or member.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Diagnostics.SwitchAttribute> attribute can be used on an assembly, class, constructor, method, property, or event.
The <xref:System.Diagnostics.SwitchAttribute> attribute can be used by tools that inspect an assembly for configuration settings.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Diagnostics.SwitchAttribute> attribute to identify the switch used in an assembly. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceSource> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Diagnostics.TraceSource2#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Diagnostics.TraceSource2/CS/program.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Diagnostics.TraceSource2#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Diagnostics.TraceSource2/VB/program.vb#2)]

Docs.param: The display name of the switch.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the name and the type of the switch.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `switchName` parameter should match the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Switch.DisplayName%2A> property of the switch.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the <xref:System.Diagnostics.SwitchAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor to create a switch attribute. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceSource> class.

Docs.returns: An array that contains all the switch attributes for the assembly.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Diagnostics.SwitchAttribute.SwitchDescription%2A> property typically indicates the function of the switch.

remarks.format:
